\begin{document}


\title{First-order scheme for 1D conservation laws of gas dynamics based on Roe's
flux-difference splitting}

\maketitle
\begin{abstract}
A short description of code ``roe\_fds.c'' found at: 

http://www.geocities.com/andrei\_chernousov/CODES/roe\_fds.tar.gz
\end{abstract}

\subsection*{Description }

The governing equations are 
\begin{equation}
\label{eg:1Dgov}
\frac{\partial \overline{U}}{\partial t}+\frac{\partial \overline{F}}{\partial x}=0,
\end{equation}


where \( \overline{U}=\left\{ \begin{array}{c}
\rho \\
\rho u\\
e_{0}
\end{array}\right\}  \), \( \overline{F}=\left\{ \begin{array}{c}
\rho u\\
\rho u^{2}+p\\
\rho uh_{0}
\end{array}\right\}  \). In case of the perfect gas we have
\[
p=(\gamma -1)[e_{0}-0.5\rho u^{2}],\]
 
\[
h_{0}=\frac{\gamma }{\gamma -1}\frac{p}{\rho }+0.5\rho u^{2},\]

\[
e_{0}=\rho h_{0}-p.\]


The first order scheme for discretization of (\ref{eg:1Dgov}) is 
\[
\overline{U}^{n+1}_{i}=\overline{U}^{n}_{i}+\Delta t\cdot L_{x}(\overline{U}^{n}_{i})=\overline{U}^{n}_{i}+\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta x}\left( \overline{F}^{n}_{i-1/2}-\overline{F}^{n}_{i+1/2}\right) ,\]


where fluxes are evaluated using Roe's {[}\ref{ref:1}{]} flux-difference splitting
\begin{equation}
\label{eg:roe_fds}
\overline{F}=\frac{1}{2}\left[ \overline{F}(\overline{U}_{L})+\overline{F}(\overline{U}_{R})-|\widetilde{A}|(\overline{U}_{R}-\overline{U}_{L})\right] ,
\end{equation}


where the matrix \( A\equiv \partial \overline{F}/\partial \widetilde{U} \)
is evaluated using Roe's average state
\[
D=\sqrt{\frac{\rho _{R}}{\rho _{L}}},\]

\[
\widetilde{\rho }=\rho _{L}D,\]
 
\[
\widetilde{u}=\frac{u_{L}+u_{R}D}{1+D},\]

\[
\widetilde{h_{0}}=\frac{h_{0L}+h_{0R}D}{1+D},\]



\[
\widetilde{a}=\sqrt{(\gamma -1)[\widetilde{h_{0}}-0.5\widetilde{u}^{2}].}\]


Introducing diagonalizing matrix transform
\[
A=S\Lambda S^{-1},\]


where \( \Lambda  \) is the diagonal matrix of eigenvalues of matrix \( A \),
we can rewrite the last term in (\ref{eg:roe_fds}) as a sum:
\[
|\widetilde{A}|(\overline{U}_{R}-\overline{U}_{L})=\widetilde{S}\widetilde{A}\widetilde{S}^{-1}\Delta \overline{U}=|\Delta \widetilde{F}_{1}|+|\Delta \widetilde{F}_{4}|+|\Delta \widetilde{F}_{5}|,\]


where these tree terms can be expressed as {[}\ref{ref:2}{]}: 
\[
|\Delta \widetilde{F}_{1}|=|\widetilde{u}|\left( \Delta \rho -\frac{\Delta p}{\widetilde{a}^{2}}\right) \left[ \begin{array}{c}
1\\
u\\
0.5u^{2}
\end{array}\right] ,\]



\[
|\Delta \widetilde{F}_{4,5}|=|\widetilde{u}\pm \widetilde{a}|\left( \frac{\Delta p\pm \widetilde{\rho }\widetilde{a}\Delta u}{2\widetilde{a}^{2}}\right) \left[ \begin{array}{c}
1\\
\widetilde{u}\pm \widetilde{a}\\
\widetilde{h_{0}}\pm \widetilde{u}\widetilde{a}
\end{array}\right] ,\]


where \( \Delta p=p_{R}-p_{L} \), \( \Delta \rho =\rho _{R}-\rho _{L} \),
\( \Delta u=u_{R}-u_{L} \).

\begin{thebibliography}{}
\bibitem{1}\label{ref:1}Roe P. L. Approximate Riemann solvers, parameter vectors and difference
scheme. // J. Comp. Phys., 1981., v. 43., pp. 357--472.
\bibitem{2}\label{ref:2}Roe P. L. Characteristic-based schemes for the Euler equations.
// Ann. Rev. Fluid. Mech., 1986., v. 8., pp. 337--369.
\end{thebibliography}
\end{document}
